name: multitudinously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that consists of many things, people, or parts: Carriage after carriage swept multitudinously past them. Wealthy people do not seem to have settled multitudinously in this area.
More examplesFewer examplesThe invitation was enthusiastically and multitudinously accepted.I watched the multitudinously windowed ships passing by in the harbour.We have devised a new method for multitudinously introducing genes into a plant.People crowded multitudinously about them.The cherry blossoms fell multitudinously to the ground like snow.
